definition: meandering and circuitous (idiom); complicated developments that never get anywhere/going around in circles
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book

sentences.english: The winding trail caused us to lose our orientation.
sentences.chinese: 迂回曲折的小道使我们迷失了方向。

sentences.english: Longitudinalcheng he solid throughout, folding fighting snake river, tortuous.
sentences.chinese: 固城河纵贯全境，河道斗折蛇行，迂回曲折。

sentences.english: Many alien plants have become introduced by highly circuitous routes.
sentences.chinese: 许多外来植物是通过极其迂回曲折的道路引进的。

sentences.english: Outside the city next to the sea, the mountain road twists and turns and winds around.
sentences.chinese: 在城外紧靠大海的地方，山路迂回曲折，四处延伸。

sentences.english: Sometimes it takes decidedly circuitous routes in planning our demise.
sentences.chinese: 有时候她果断而迂回曲折地筹划对我们的谋杀计划。

sentences.english: It can not accept any circuitous twists and turns of warmth.
sentences.chinese: 容不下任何迂回曲折的温暖。

sentences.english: I entered the village by the little roundabout lane.
sentences.chinese: 我由一条迂回曲折的小径进了村。

definition: road as twisty as sheep's intestine (idiom); narrow and winding road/fig. complicated and tricky job
winding road (twisting and turning like a sheep's intestine)
topography of a mountain/features of a mountain
uneven and jumbled (idiom); irregular and disorderly/in a tangled mess
